job.title: je
job.description:
{"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "JobPosting", "datePosted": "2021-10-01T17:47:11.000Z", "description": "Position Summary

As a Software Engineer, you will be a part of a collaborative team that develops with others in Resilience to provide applications and solutions for instruments and analytical software for novel therapeutics. This role will work with stakeholders to develop software-based solutions to manufacturing challenges and develop next-generation therapies and instruments. You will join a dynamic, fast-paced organization and team developing innovative solutions, and you will need to work independently in a collaborative team.

Resilience is looking for intelligent, motivated software engineers who enjoy taking on complex challenges, work well in an agile, dynamic environment, and care about high-quality engineering best practices.

Job Responsibilities
  • Develop software (Python, C#) to interface, control, and monitor manufacturing instruments, quality assurance equipment, and visualization tools for analytical analysis.
  • Developing applications that are cloud-focused with
  • Gather requirements and generate specifications for software application systems.
  • Contribute to the improvement of our Software Development Life Cycle.
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced Agile team environment
  • Contribute towards investigation and resolution of technical problems
  • Innovate at the SW component level and influence decisions in subsystem architecture and design.
  • Contribute towards unit testing, continuous integration, and deployment activities
Qualifications
  • Strong knowledge of programming with C#, Java, or other object-oriented languages
  • Strong understanding of scripting languages, including Python and bash
  • Understanding of object-oriented analysis and design
  • Proven ability to self-manage and have an ability to deal well with ambiguity and work independently and as a multidisciplinary analytical research team member in a fast-paced environment.
  • Background knowledge in computational biology, immunology, wet-lab experimental procedures, and data analysis is a plus.
Preferred Experience
  • BSc/MS: 1-2 years of experience or Ph.D. in a scientific-analytical field, e.g., computer science, bioinformatics, data science, or neurology.
  • Experience with source control management repositories (such as GIT, SVN, etc.) and Configuration Management
  • Knowledge and experience with cloud application development
